content.text:
Here is my attempt at the task, following the specified output format:

Involving Parents and Older Students to Facilitate Complex Play

1. Recruit parent volunteers to lead small group activities - Have parents sign up to help with specific activities aligned to their interests and skills - Train parent volunteers on facilitating focused, complex play with the children - Schedule parents to lead activities on a rotating basis 2. Partner with middle or high school classes - Reach out to older grades to set up a buddy program - Have older students come in regularly to engage in educational play with the younger children - Older students can lead games, read stories, help with art projects, etc. to make activities more involved 3. Set up activity stations - Create stations around the classroom focused on different types of complex play - Have parent volunteers and older student helpers staff the stations - Stations allow children to rotate through focused activities in small groups with adult facilitation 4. Communicate with parents - Share information with parents about the importance of complex play - Suggest ways parents can encourage this type of play at home - Update parents regularly about class activities and opportunities for involvement
